item.title: A Nintendo Direct will take place this Friday – will we see Metroid Prime 4?
item.content:encoded:
The next Nintendo Direct has been confirmed to take place this week on Friday 12th September at 2PM UK time (3PM CEST / 10AM EDT / 8AM PDT).

The news has come exclusively through the Nintendo Today app at this moment, and there’s minimal details outside of the date and time. Typically we are given information of the length of time and some kind of indication on the scope of the Direct, whether the focus will be on a particular system, first or third parties, or indies, but the walled garden of information presented within Nintendo Today doesn’t have this.

More information will likely come out as the news spreads to Nintendo’s public social media and the placeholder YouTube stream page goes live.

Until then… we’ll probably get a release date for Metroid Prime 4 this time, wouldn’t you think? The game is still set for launch in 2025, and is a significant first party project for both the length of its development and the fact that it’s coming to both Nintendo Switch and Switch 2.

Source: Nintendo Today

item.title: Dambuster tease Dead Island 3, but where will the next outbreak be?
item.content:encoded:
Dambuster Studio has teased that they’re working on Dead Island 3, a sequel to their hit series revival with Dead Island 2.

Writing in a note that celebrates 14 years since the first Dead Island game was released by original developer Techland, the studio also noted that over 20 million people have played Dead Island 2 since its release in 2023, before closing out that “the details stay under wraps, the outbreak is far from over…”

It looks like Jacob is set to return for the next game, traipsing down a dusty road out of LA, and this could be giving us some clues as to where the next game will be set. The look of the road would suggest that he’s heading toward the desert inland, possibly towards Las Vegas, most likely, but could we be jet setting off to another country? The stickers on his luggage mention Banoi, the island where this series started, and LA, but there’s also stickers for Australia, Ireland and the Coliseum. Obviously these would logically be places where he’s visited in the past, but teasers don’t always have to make too much sense.

Dead Island 2’s success is great to see, given the difficulties that the game went through in getting made. Techland had a messy breakup with publisher Deep Silver (now Plaion) and went off to make their Dying Light series, while the Dead Island franchise stuck with the publisher. They initially partnered with Yager (Spec Ops: The Line), but after the game’s announcement at E3 2014, development didn’t progress as planned, and the game was taken away and given to Nottingham-based Dambuster Studios, the team previously behind Homefront: The Revolution, but with a longer lineage back through to the TimeSplitters franchise.

The game is a solid return for the zombie smashing series, as I wrote in our Dead Island 2 review, “Dead Island 2 does a great job of reanimating this dormant zombie-battling series, with the gore-filled combat and excessive weaponry that goes well with the oversaturated LA setting. It’s an enjoyable romp, but at the same time, ironically feels like it’s playing it safe.”

Source: Steam

item.title: Tainted Grail: Fall of Avalon update 1.1 is out now
item.content:encoded:
Developer Questline has announced that update 1.1 for its open world dark fantasy RPG Tainted Grail: Fall of Avalon is now available, and it brings a lot of changes to the game as well fixes. One of the new additions is New Game Plus, but there is also a big nerf of removing gain of crit chance from items due to it being too easy to reach 100% that broke the balancing in New Game Plus. You can read the full patch notes following the trailer.

  • New Game Plus

    • The entire world is reset. You can complete the game with new choices

    • You lose your: King’s Power, learned recipes, quests, keys and readable items. Everything else is kept.

    • Your armor is debuffed for each NG+ level.

    • Enemies are stronger and have higher status resistances.

    • All items found and crafted are stronger and rewards are improved.

    • A couple of enemies will drop more loot.

  • Lots of fixes and improvements to the 3rd act of the game, along with new content as well. Details below.

  • [Transmog] A new transmogrification feature is now available at the handcrafting station (no charge at the player’s home). You can now change the visual appearance of your items to any discovered style in the game (for the same types of items).

  • Added origin potion recipe to Helled’s sanctum from the alchemist questline.

  • Added an unread status marker to readable items to clearly indicate which ones have not been read yet. (All readables in your inventory will be assumed read)

  • The journal now has more than 120 entries about NPC characters, along with new lore entries. Most of them apply retroactively.

  • Added new dialogues for Kvorr and Black Annis for players whose attempts for a new pet did not work out too well for them

  • Qrko – your pet has received a couple of new practical tricks for you to try out.

  • [FPP] Headbobbing has been added. You can enable it in your game settings.

  • [TPP] Improved spine IK in TPP so that the player does not hunch over as much while traveling. A blend was also added for actions such as bow draw to prevent instant snapping.

  • Added alphabetical sorting for items and fixed an issue where identical items did not appear next to each other after certain sorts.

  • Added bulk options for items in shops and stashes.

  • [Optim] Significant RAM optimizations that should improve late-game stability on consoles. We’re also working on another console stability optimization, which will be released once it’s ready.

  • Mage

    • Ring: Ring of Reduced Conjuration – Summons block 20% less mana.

    • Amulet: Pendant of Endless Study – Increases Spell Power by 1% for each character level you have.

    • Amulet: Witchglass – All negative status effects are 50% stronger on your enemies. All negative status effects are 50% weaker on you, but last 100% longer.

    • Amulet: Sanguine Heart – Bleed you apply has 100% increased duration, but deals 50% less damage.

    • Gem: Smouldering Wrath – Critical hits light your weapon on fire for 5 s, increasing its damage by 15% and burning enemies.

  • Melee

    • Armor: Ripper’s Jacket – Increases parry window when dual-wielding weapons. Blocking costs 80% less stamina when dual-wielding.

    • 1h Axe: Titanium Tonic – Increases physical damage by 1% per missing health point.

    • Gem: Gambit Scale – Increases your Dash invincibility window by 0.02 seconds. Receiving Damage has a 25 % chance to lower your Movement Speed by half for 3s.

    • Back: Stoneback Cloak – All Damage received is applied over 4s duration, instead of instantly.

  • Archers

    • Light Bow: Assassin’s Bow – Attacks have a 10% chance to Blind. Sneak attacks have an 80% chance to Blind.

    • Heavy Bow: Harrowbend – Using this bow does not cost any stamina. Missing a target results in maximum Overexertion.

  • Stealth

    • Dagger: Quiet Death – Deals 200% increased backstab damage.

    • Armor: Ashwalker Boots – Your footsteps produce no sound.

  • Hybrid

    • Back: Harness of Inverse Rite – When you hit an enemy with a melee attack, your next ranged attack has 66% increased damage. When you hit an enemy with a ranged attack, your next melee attack has 66% increased damage.

    • Armor: Hexgrip Vambraces – Increases physical damage by 50% of your Spell Power.

    • Amulet: Triskelion Core – Your Max Health is equal to your Max Stamina. Your Max Stamina is equal to your Max Mana. Your Max Mana is equal to your Max Health.

  • Missing recipes for some armor and coatings have been added to their recipe books. These books were also added to new sources, so that even if you sold the recipe book, it will be available to you.

  • Players’ armor is now hard-capped at 95%.

item.title: Pacific Drive: Whispers in the Woods DLC has a grindhouse horror vibe to its trailer
item.content:encoded:
The first big DLC for Pacific Drive has been announced, with a new mystery to unfurl and new regions within the Olympic Exclusion Zone to explore in Pacific Drive: Whispers in the Woods later this year.

This is a brand new story for you and your station wagon to venture into, as a group of Anomaly-obsessed fanatics have come to the OEZ and are making things get even weirder. The DLC promises an 8-12 hours narrative arc that you can branch off and play through within both new and existing saves – it will open up to you after the first few hours – with a new cast of characters and additional side content to discover as well.

The fanatics have come to the OEZ and left their mark, transforming the familiar Pacific Northwest forest with strange altars and new resources. There’s also new anomalies and anomaly behaviours to uncover. Alongside this are Artifcats, a new gameplay system with objects that bring new changes and effects to you and the world around you. Carrying Artifacts will increase the challenge you face, but can also be key to your survival and progress.

Pacific Drive was an indie treat from early last year, blending survival gameplay with needing to maintain and upgrade your station wagon, driving to explore new and more distant areas in a quest to make it through the OEZ.

item.title: Destiny 2’s Star Wars inspired Renegades expansion launches December 2nd
item.content:encoded:
Bungie has announced that its Star Wars inspired Renegades expansion will launch on December 2nd, and the developer has released a developer video to go into some of the content. Renegades has been a collaborative work with Lucasfilm Games to bring elements of Star Wars to Destiny, including lightsabers, the AT-ST Walker, and blasters.

In the video, the developers draw various comparisons between Destiny in Star Wars. For example, Destiny’s Barant Imperium are like the Empire, the Dredgen are like the Sith, and the Praxic Order are similar to the Jedi. The story itself puts you in the criminal underworld of Destiny’s universe, meaning dealing and allying with various syndicates to reach your goals, with Drifter taking the lead role in your group, going against the orders of The Vanguard. Players will be sent to the Lawless Frontier to work together while using Renegade abilities, to rise up through the ranks of the criminal underworld. The locations of these maps have also been inspired by Star Wars, with Europa having elements of Hoth, Mars has Sarlaac like pits and Venus is like the swamps of Dagobah. The jobs you will be able to undertake include smuggling, bounty hunting, and sabotage. The Renegade abilities you will be able to equip to help on these jobs are things like air strikes, drop pods, the Cabal Walker, turrets, swoop bikes, interceptors. There are a total of nine abilities and seven upgrades to unlock.

The hub of Destiny 2 Renegades is Tharsis Outpost, which has become a true hive of scum and villainy. The criminal syndicates have set up their headquarters on Tharsis while The Vanguard have been busy elsewhere. The three syndicates that call Thasis Outpost home are the Eliksni Pikers, that are described as a biker gang. The Totality Division is a subset of the Barant Imperium, and is run by Psions. The final group is the Tharsis Reformation, a breakaway Vex group that is learning more about individualism. Bungie has also confirmed that Invasion will return in Renegades too.

Source: YouTube
